home.welcome_text: Welcome to Great Commission Bible Church. We are a community of believers dedicated to spreading the Gospel and making disciples. Join us as we worship, learn, and grow together in faith.

February.title: An invitation to celebrate pt.1
February.summary: The leaders and people of Israel gave willingly to the construction of the Temple. The people rejoiced at its completion, for they had given freely and wholeheartedly to the Lord for the building of His Temple.

February.title: An invitation to celebrate pt.2 (Invitation, Participation, Rejoicing)
February.summary: We are part of the Body of Christ, built on the foundation of the apostles and the prophets, with Christ as the chief cornerstone. We are built together to be a dwelling (a Holy Temple for God), in which God lives by His Holy Spirit.
key_points: Invitation :- God invites us to participate in a glorious celebration. It's a journey that requires us to Listen, Submit, and Rejoice.
We are to listen as God calls, submitting outselves to Him as a living sacrifice (Romans 12: 1-2)
Participation :- We are to willingly give of our time, abilities, resources etc. We are to get involved.
Rejoicing :- We rejoice at the outcome as we are  willing, enthusiastic and grateful to be part of the Body of Christ (His Temple).

featured_testimony.name: Sister Lee
featured_testimony.testimony: My mother faithfully did her best to teach me about Jesus. I actually understood in my early 20‚Äôs that God‚Äôs ways are better than my ways when I became a single mother.  I believe I was told by God Himself in my darkest moment,  ‚ÄúBut Jesus forgives sin‚Äù.  Looking back, I think this was the point when I made Jesus my ‚ÄúSaviour‚Äù  because there was nothing I could do about my sin. It took another a few years, to learn and understand that God  redeems sin - past, present and future, and could and would work it for my good and His glory (Romans 8:28, Isaiah 61:1-4).  I was ALL in! I surrendered my life to Jesus to be used for His eternal purposes. I now know this is what it means to make Jesus my ‚ÄúLord‚Äù.  The Lord was and continued to be faithful to His sanctifying work and establishing my identity as His daughter over the next 20 years. I continually sought to serve Him - my passion and sweet spot being facilitating ladies Bible study, sharing what I was learning. But, there was more. Around turning 50, God began to show me my need for His healing love that deepens and seals a trusting relationship with Him; no doubts and fears about His sovereignty over my life no matter the stormy circumstances. This is the place of true rest for my soul. There are not enough words to express my gratitude.
